name: autohide the menu & sidebar [The Verge]
description: Hides The Verge's footer and "The Latest" at the left edge of the screen. Shrinks the article images, removes the self-quotes from the article body. (But not permanently - hover at the edges of the screen to restore them.)
additional_info:
[NB: The Verge's layout has changed considerably since 2013, so the following may not be completely current.] The icons in the upper-left and lower-right corners of the screen are the collapsed header and footer. The thin vertical bar at the left edge of the screen is the collapsed sidebar. Mouse over them to restore the elements.
  • Reduce the ridiculously large headline font
  • Remove the banner-sized quotes of the article itself by the article
  • Move the superfluous lead photo below the text of the article Shrink the superfluous lead image (and other images in the article body)
  • On zoom (ctrl+plus) let the article become wider, but no wider than the screen
